intro: Tithymalus rupestris, commonly known as the rock tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species in many areas.
